long: Meaning: an "eye" (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a "fountain" (as the "eye" of the landscape).  Usage: affliction, outward appearance,   before,   think best, colour, conceit,   be content, countenance,   displease, eye((-brow), (-d), -sight), face,   favour, fountain, furrow (from the margin), × him,   humble, knowledge, look, (  well), × me, open(-ly),   (not) please, presence,   regard, resemblance, sight, × thee, × them,   think, × us, well, × you(-rselves).  Source: probably a primitive word;
